designScenario.name: Ignition System
designScenario.description: The Ignition System is a critical aerospace subsystem responsible for initiating and sustaining combustion in aircraft engines under varying flight conditions. It ensures precise spark generation, timing synchronization, and fault tolerance to maintain engine performance across altitudes, temperatures, and operational loads. The design integrates advanced electronics and robust mechanical components to meet stringent safety and reliability standards.

details.description: The system must synchronize spark timing with engine crankshaft position and RPM to optimize combustion efficiency during all flight phases.
Deliver a minimum of 50 mJ per spark across all engine operating conditions, including high-altitude and low-temperature environments.
Implement dual ignition coils per cylinder and fail-safe isolation mechanisms to prevent catastrophic engine failure in the event of component malfunction.
Ensure operational reliability within temperature ranges of -55°C to +95°C and altitudes up to 45,000 feet.

systemComponents.name: Ignition Control Unit (ICU)
systemComponents.description: The central processing unit that regulates spark timing, monitors sensor data, and manages redundancy protocols. It interfaces with engine management systems to ensure precise combustion control.

subComponents.name: Microcontroller
subComponents.description: Processes input signals and executes ignition timing algorithms.

subComponents.name: Power Supply Module
subComponents.description: Converts aircraft electrical power to the high-voltage required for spark generation.

systemComponents.name: Ignition Coils
systemComponents.description: High-voltage transformers that generate spark energy for the spark plugs. Each coil is paired with a cylinder for direct ignition.

subComponents.name: Primary Winding
subComponents.description: Receives low-voltage input from the ICU.

subComponents.name: Secondary Winding
subComponents.description: Induces high-voltage output for spark delivery.

systemComponents.name: Spark Plugs
systemComponents.description: Delivers the spark to ignite the fuel-air mixture within engine cylinders. Designed for high durability under extreme thermal and mechanical stress.

subComponents.name: Center Electrode
subComponents.description: Primary conductor for the spark discharge.

subComponents.name: Ground Electrode
subComponents.description: Receives the spark to initiate combustion.

systemComponents.name: Ignition Sensors
systemComponents.description: Monitors critical ignition parameters such as spark energy, cylinder pressure, and coil temperature to ensure optimal performance and fault detection.

subComponents.name: Voltage Sensor
subComponents.description: Measures high-voltage output from ignition coils.

subComponents.name: Temperature Sensor
subComponents.description: Tracks coil and plug temperatures to prevent overheating.

systemComponents.name: Redundant Ignition System
systemComponents.description: A secondary ignition circuit that activates automatically if the primary system fails, ensuring continued engine operation during emergencies.

subComponents.name: Backup ICU
subComponents.description: Independent control unit for the redundant ignition coils.

subComponents.name: Secondary Ignition Coils
subComponents.description: Standby coils for each cylinder, isolated from the primary system.

relationships.description: The ICU regulates the ignition timing and energy delivery to the ignition coils.
The spark plugs depend on the ignition coils to receive high-voltage for spark generation.
Sensor data from ignition coils and plugs are aggregated by the ICU for real-time monitoring and control.
The redundant system depends on the primary ICU's fault signals to initiate automatic activation.
The ICU coordinates with the redundant system to ensure seamless failover during primary system failures.

attributes.name: ignitionVoltage
attributes.description: Specifies the high-voltage output range required for reliable spark generation across all engine conditions.

attributes.name: sparkEnergy
attributes.description: Defines the minimum energy per spark to ensure consistent ignition of fuel-air mixtures, even at high altitudes.

attributes.name: systemRedundancy
attributes.value: Dual redundant ignition coils per cylinder
attributes.description: Indicates the level of redundancy to prevent engine shutdown in case of primary system failure.

attributes.name: operationalTemperatureRange
attributes.description: Specifies the temperature range within which the system operates reliably.

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: The maximum time required for the system to initiate a spark after receiving a startup command.

attributes.name: sensorAccuracy
attributes.description: The precision of temperature sensors in monitoring ignition component thermal conditions.

comments.body: Manages ignition sequence timing and voltage regulation.
